Name: official/smeagol
Description: Store your technical documentation with in your git repositories

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Smeagol process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Smeagol: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Smeagol process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Smeagol: 50%

Name: premium/backup
Description: Backup Dogu for the Cloudogu EcoSystem

Configuration.Name: active
Configuration.Description: Choose if the automatic backup-mechanism is active.

Configuration.Name: ignore_dogu_health
Configuration.Description: Skip dogu health checks before backup

Configuration.Name: time
Configuration.Description: The time of a scheduled backup. A backup is scheduled then every day at this time. Format HH:MM, ex.: 12:30

Configuration.Name: encryption_key
Configuration.Description: A key which is needed to access the backup.

Configuration.Name: backup_type
Configuration.Description: Choose a backup-type. Currently 'SFTP', 'S3' and 'local' are possible options.

Configuration.Name: sftp_config/address
Configuration.Description: The address of a sftp server.

Configuration.Name: s3_bucket_config/address
Configuration.Description: The address of a S3-bucket.

Configuration.Name: s3_bucket_config/access_key_id
Configuration.Description: The access id of the S3-bucket.

Configuration.Name: s3_bucket_config/secret_access_key
Configuration.Description: The secret key of the S3-bucket.

Configuration.Name: local_config/path
Configuration.Description: The absolute path to a local directory.

Configuration.Name: retention_enabled
Configuration.Description: Choose if the automatic backup removal mechanism is active. (true/false)

Configuration.Name: retention_strategy
Configuration.Description: Select the strategy which governs how backups are kept or removed. (e.g. removeAllButKeepLatest, keepLastSevenDays, keep7Days1Month1Quarter1Year)

Configuration.Name: metrics_token
Configuration.Description: Access token for healthcheck- and metric-endpoint.

Configuration.Name: rest_token
Configuration.Description: Access token for API-calls.

Configuration.Name: admin_role
Configuration.Description: Role required to access the backup-dogu. If not configured the global admin_group will be used.

Configuration.Name: deny_cross_blueprint_restores
Configuration.Description: Value can be true or false. When true all backups are bound to a specific blueprintId and cannot be restored after a blueprint-upgrade. When false or not set this feature is disabled.

Configuration.Name: pre_backup_script
Configuration.Description: Value can be set to an absolute path to a bash script. That script is executed before a backup is started.

Configuration.Name: post_backup_script
Configuration.Description: Value can be set to an absolute path to a bash script. That script is executed after a backup has finished successfully.

Configuration.Name: pre_restore_script
Configuration.Description: Value can be set to an absolute path to a bash script. That script is executed before a restore is started.

Configuration.Name: post_restore_script
Configuration.Description: Value can be set to an absolute path to a bash script. That script is executed after a restore has finished successfully.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Name: official/gotenberg
Description: A Docker-powered stateless API for PDF files.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO or DEBUG. Default is INFO

Name: official/scm
Description: The easiest way to share and manage your Git, Mercurial and Subversion repositories over http.

Configuration.Name: plugin_center_url
Configuration.Description: URL of SCM-Manager Plugin Center

Configuration.Name: plugin_center_authentication_url
Configuration.Description: URL of SCM-Manager Plugin Center authentication service. To delete the URL and hence disable plugin center authentication, set this to 'none'.

Configuration.Name: release_feed_url
Configuration.Description: URL of SCM-Manager release RSS feed

Configuration.Name: login_info_url
Configuration.Description: URL for the login info. To delete the URL and hence disable the login info feature, set this to 'none'

Configuration.Name: alerts_url
Configuration.Description: URL for alerts in SCM-Manager. To delete the URL and hence disable the alerts feature, set this to 'none'

Configuration.Name: disable_release_feed
Configuration.Description: If set to 'true', SCM-Manager will not query for new releases

Configuration.Name: additional_plugins
Configuration.Description: Comma separated list of plugin names to install on start. Uninstalled plugins will also be installed again, since they are defined as default.

Configuration.Name: update_plugins
Configuration.Description: Set to 'true' to install available plugin updates on startup

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). We recommend at least 1200m of memory for SCM.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the SCM process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for SCM: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the SCM process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for SCM: 50%

Configuration.Name: redmine_type
Configuration.Description: If both, Redmine and EasyRedmine are installed, this sets which instance should be configured

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG or TRACE. Default is INFO

Configuration.Name: caching/workdir/size
Configuration.Description: Size of cache for working directories used to edit repository content, for example using the editor or the review plugin. To disable cache, clean this value.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: caching/stores/enabled
Configuration.Description: To enable store caches, set this to 'true'.

Configuration.Name: caching/dataFiles/size
Configuration.Description: To enable data file caches, set this to an integer value > 0.

Name: official/cas
Description: The Central Authentication Service (CAS) is a single sign-on protocol for the web.

Configuration.Name: limit/failure_threshold
Configuration.Description: Number of failed login attempts. This number is used to calculate the failure rate in conjunction with limit/range_seconds. (0 means disabled; defaults to 500)

Configuration.Name: limit/range_seconds
Configuration.Description: Time in seconds defines timeframe over which the login failures are taken into account (must be a positive number, takes only effect if limit/failure_threshold is > 0; defaults to 10 seconds)

Configuration.Name: limit/stale_removal_interval
Configuration.Description: Time in seconds between background runs which finds and removes clean expired and stale login failures (must be a positive number, takes only effect if limit/failure_threshold is > 0; defaults to 60 seconds)

Configuration.Name: limit/lock_time
Configuration.Description: Time in seconds to lock an account if the throttling threshold was met; (must be a positive number, takes only effect if limit/failure_threshold is > 0; defaults to 600 seconds)

Configuration.Name: mail_sender
Configuration.Description: Email address to use as sender of the CAS dogu

Configuration.Name: password_management/enable_password_reset_via_email
Configuration.Description: Specifies whether the functionality for resetting the password via a link sent by e-mail should be activated. This entry is set to 'true' by default.

Configuration.Name: password_management/reset_password_subject
Configuration.Description: Specifies the subject of the e-mail when resetting the password.

Configuration.Name: password_management/reset_password_text
Configuration.Description: Specifies the text for the password reset email. Note: The password reset link must be inserted mandatory with ${url}

Configuration.Name: forgot_password_text
Configuration.Description: Text which shall be shown if a user clicks 'Forgot Password'. Note: The button 'Forgot password' is only visible if the value 'enable_password_reset_via_email' is not `true`.

Configuration.Name: legal_urls/terms_of_service
Configuration.Description: This URL links to the Terms of Service and will be the first link at the bottom of login or logout pages. If empty the whole link will be omitted. If changed the CAS dogu must be restarted to take effect.

Configuration.Name: legal_urls/imprint
Configuration.Description: This URL links to the Imprint and will be the second link at the bottom of login or logout pages. If empty the whole link will be omitted. If changed the CAS dogu must be restarted to take effect.

Configuration.Name: legal_urls/privacy_policy
Configuration.Description: This URL links to the Privacy Policy and will be the last link at the bottom of login or logout pages. If empty the whole link will be omitted. If changed the CAS dogu must be restarted to take effect.

Configuration.Name: session_tgt/max_time_to_live_in_seconds
Configuration.Description: Maximum session timeout - TGT will expire after defined timespan regardless the usage

Configuration.Name: session_tgt/time_to_kill_in_seconds
Configuration.Description: Idle session timeout -  TGT will expire sooner if no further requests keep the session alive

Configuration.Name: ldap/host
Configuration.Description: The host of the LDAP (without protocol and without port), e.g. ldap if LDAP dogu is used.

Configuration.Name: ldap/port
Configuration.Description: The port of the LDAP, e.g. 389

Configuration.Name: ldap/base_dn
Configuration.Description: Base DN of users to be authenticated, "(dc=cloudogu,dc=com)". This value is only used when using an external LDAP.

Configuration.Name: ldap/connection_dn
Configuration.Description: Manager DN for authenticated searches, e.g. "(cn=admin,dc=cloudogu,dc=com)" This value is only used when using an external LDAP.

Configuration.Name: ldap/password
Configuration.Description: The password for connection to ldap in encrypted form. This value is only used when using an external LDAP.

Configuration.Name: ldap/search_filter
Configuration.Description: Search filter used for configurations that require searching for DNs, e.g. (objectClass=person)

Configuration.Name: ldap/ds_type
Configuration.Description: Type of the LDAP

Configuration.Name: ldap/encryption
Configuration.Description: Type of the encryption of the LDAP. Defaults to 'none'.

Configuration.Name: ldap/attribute_id
Configuration.Description: The attribute for the user ID in the LDAP

Configuration.Name: ldap/attribute_given_name
Configuration.Description: The attribute for the user's given name in the LDAP

Configuration.Name: ldap/attribute_surname
Configuration.Description: The attribute for the user's surname in the LDAP

Configuration.Name: ldap/attribute_fullname
Configuration.Description: The attribute for the user's fullname in the LDAP, which can also be seen as display name like "John Doe"

Configuration.Name: ldap/attribute_mail
Configuration.Description: The attribute for the user's mail address in the LDAP

Configuration.Name: ldap/attribute_group
Configuration.Description: The user's group membership attribute (e.g. memberOf)

Configuration.Name: ldap/group_attribute_name
Configuration.Description: Name of the attribute for groups (the group's user membership attribute) in LDAP, e.g. member

Configuration.Name: ldap/group_base_dn
Configuration.Description: Settings for ldap group search by member. Base dn for group search e.g.: o=ces.local,dc=cloudogu,dc=com

Configuration.Name: ldap/group_search_filter
Configuration.Description: Search filter for group search. If this property is empty, group search by member will be skipped

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 virtual CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU. This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 virtual CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU. This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the CAS process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for CAS: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the CAS process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for CAS: 50%

Configuration.Name: oidc/enabled
Configuration.Description: Determines whether the CAS should use the configured OIDC provider for delegated authentication. This entry is set to 'false' by default.

Configuration.Name: oidc/discovery_uri
Configuration.Description: Describes the URI that contains the description for the OIDC protocol of the target provider.

Configuration.Name: oidc/client_id
Configuration.Description: Contains the identifier that should be used to identify the client against the OIDC provider.

Configuration.Name: oidc/client_secret
Configuration.Description: Contains the secret that should be used along the client ID to identify the client against the OIDC provider.

Configuration.Name: oidc/display_name
Configuration.Description: The display name is used for the OIDC provider in the user interface.

Configuration.Name: oidc/redirect_uri
Configuration.Description: The url which will be used as redirect target after a successful delegated logout. The url has to match the patterns which are allowed for the configured client. [defaults to <instance>/cas/logout]

Configuration.Name: oidc/optional
Configuration.Description: Determines whether the authentication via the configured OIDC provider is optional. The user is automatically redirected to the login page of the OIDC provider if this property is set to 'false'. The 'true' entry makes authentication via the OIDC provider optional. For this, an additional button for the OIDC provider is displayed on the login page of the CAS, which can be used for authentication with the OIDC provider. This entry is set to 'false' by default.

Configuration.Name: oidc/scopes
Configuration.Description: Specifies the resource to be queried against OIDC. Normally, this enumeration should contain at least the openid, user's email, profile information, and the groups assigned to the user. This entry is set to `openid email profile groups` by default.

Configuration.Name: oidc/attribute_mapping
Configuration.Description: The attributes provided by OIDC do not exactly match the attributes required by the CAS. It is necessary to transform the OIDC attributes into attributes accepted by the cas. Therefore, this entry should contain rules to transform an attribute provided by the OIDC provider into an attribute required by CAS. The rules should be provided in the following format: 'email:mail,family_name:surname'. With the given example the OIDC attribute 'email' and 'family_name' are transformed into 'mail' and 'surname' respectively. The CAS requires the following attributes to function properly: 'mail,surname,givenName,username,displayName'.

Configuration.Name: oidc/principal_attribute
Configuration.Description: Specifies an attribute that should be used as principal id inside the CES. CAS uses the ID provided by the OIDC provider when this property is empty.

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Configuration.Name: disable_access_log
Configuration.Description: Disable logging of incoming requests

Configuration.Name: google_tracking_id
Configuration.Description: Google Analytics Tracking ID

Configuration.Name: html_content_url
Configuration.Description: URL path to reach all custom html content pages. Default value when unset: static

Configuration.Name: ignore_service_health
Configuration.Description: Option to ignore the health status of all dogus. Makes it possible to access dogus even if they are unhealthy

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). We recommend to have at least allocated 20m for additional tools (ces-confd) running inside the container.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: relayhost
Configuration.Description: The next-hop destination of non-local mail

Configuration.Name: sasl_username
Configuration.Description: username for sasl authentication

Configuration.Name: sasl_password
Configuration.Description: password for sasl authentication, if the mail relay server needs an md5 encrypted password pass the encrypted password in here otherwise plain

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_security_level
Configuration.Description: The default SMTP TLS security level for the Postfix SMTP client

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_cert_file
Configuration.Description: Postfix SMTP client RSA certificate in PEM format

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_key_file
Configuration.Description: Postfix SMTP client RSA private key in PEM format

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_CAfile
Configuration.Description: CA certificates of root CAs trusted to sign either remote SMTP server certificates or intermediate CA certificates

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_loglevel
Configuration.Description: Enable additional Postfix SMTP client logging of TLS activity

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_exclude_ciphers
Configuration.Description: List of ciphers or cipher types to exclude from the Postfix SMTP client cipher list at all TLS security levels

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_mandatory_ciphers
Configuration.Description: The minimum TLS cipher grade that the Postfix SMTP client will use with mandatory TLS encryption

Configuration.Name: smtp_tls_mandatory_protocols
Configuration.Description: List of SSL/TLS protocols that the Postfix SMTP client will use with mandatory TLS encryption

Configuration.Name: smtpd_forbid_bare_newline
Configuration.Description: Disables support for malformed line endings in SMTP. This fixes CVE-2023-51764 but could break (rare) clients that mis-implement SMTP.

Configuration.Name: smtpd_forbid_bare_newline_exclusions
Configuration.Description: List of clients for which bare newlines should still be allowed. See https://www.postfix.org/postconf.5.html#smtpd_forbid_bare_newline_exclusions

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU. This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU. This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). This configuration is only applicable to the Multinode-EcoSystem.

Name: official/sonar
Description: SonarQube is an open source quality management platform, dedicated to continuously analyze and measure source code quality

Configuration.Name: sonar.updatecenter.url
Configuration.Description: Set custom SonarQube UpdateCenter URL

Configuration.Name: sonar.plugins.default
Configuration.Description: Comma separated list of plugin names to install on start

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_main_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar main process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar main: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_main_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar main process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar main: 50%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_web_max_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar web background process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar web: 10%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_search_max_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar search background process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar search: 10%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_sonar_cengine_max_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Sonar compute engine background process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Sonar compute engine: 10%

Configuration.Name: amend_projects_with_ces_admin_permissions
Configuration.Description: If set to 'all', the ces-admin group will be enabled to administer all projects. This key will automatically reset to 'none' afterwards.

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal ephemeral storage requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Name: official/redmine
Description: Redmine is a flexible project management web application

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: etcd_redmine_config
Configuration.Description: Applies default configuration to redmine.

Configuration.Name: pwd_reset_selected_by_default
Configuration.Description: Specifies whether the checkbox for the password change at the next login attribute should be preselected by default

Configuration.Name: mail/sender
Configuration.Description: Email address to use as sender of the User Management dogu

Configuration.Name: mail/import/subject
Configuration.Description: The subject of the mail, which is send when a user is imported via the csv import feature

Configuration.Name: mail/import/content
Configuration.Description: The content of the mail, which is send when a User is imported via the csv import feature. Within the content the placeholders ${username} and ${password} need to be included.

Configuration.Name: mail/import/max_retries
Configuration.Description: The number of maximum retries to send a mail, before an error occurs

Configuration.Name: mail/import/max_retry_delay
Configuration.Description: The maximum delay for sending an email as part of a retry. By using a backoff strategy, the waiting time increases for each failed send until max_retry_delay is reached before the mail is sent again.

Configuration.Name: mail/import/retry_interval
Configuration.Description: The interval in which failed mails will be checked to be sent again.

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). We recommend at least 200m of memory for usermgt.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Usermgt process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Usermgt: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Usermgt process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Usermgt: 50%

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG.

Name: official/nexus
Description: The Nexus Repository is like the local warehouse where all of the parts and finished goods used in your software supply chain are stored and distributed.

Configuration.Name: claim/once
Configuration.Description: A claim script definition which is only executed once. After that, it will set the claim/once.lock key which prevents further execution.

Configuration.Name: claim/once.lock
Configuration.Description: If this key is set to true it will prevent the claim/once script from being executed.

Configuration.Name: claim/always
Configuration.Description: A claim script definition which will always be executed at startup.

Configuration.Name: nexus.repository.sandbox.enable
Configuration.Description: Enable repository sandboxing

Configuration.Name: installDefaultDockerRegistry
Configuration.Description: If set to false, the default docker registry is not installed

Configuration.Name: disableOutreachManagement
Configuration.Description: Disable the outreach management capability

Configuration.Name: logging/root
Configuration.Description: Set the root log level to one of ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG. The default log level is set to "WARN"

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). We recommend to add 50m for additional tools running inside the container.

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_max_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Nexus process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has more than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Nexus: 25%

Configuration.Name: container_config/java_min_ram_percentage
Configuration.Description: Limits the heap stack size of the Nexus process to the configured percentage of the available physical memory when the container has less than approx. 250 MB of memory available. Is only considered when a memory_limit is set. Use a valid float value with decimals between 0 and 100 (f. ex. 55.0 for 55%). Default value for Nexus: 50%

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/notes
Configuration.Description: Notes to the default cleanup-policy. Default: "Do not edit. CES will re-generate this default policy during each Nexus start-up that will overwrite your changes. You may want to create your own policies which will stay untouched during the start-up."
Configuration.Default: Do not edit. CES will re-generate this default policy during each Nexus start-up that will overwrite your changes. You may want to create your own policies which will stay untouched during the start-up.

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/policy_format
Configuration.Description: Repository format on which the default cleanup-policy can be applied. The default is "maven2" which corresponds to maven repositories

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/criteria/regex
Configuration.Description: Regex which will be used to match fitting artifacts. Default: ".*SNAPSHOT"

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/criteria/release_type
Configuration.Description: The release type on which this policy will be applied. This configuration can only be applied if the 'policy_format' is of type "maven2", "yum" and "npm". Default: "PRERELEASES"

Configuration.Name: cleanup_policy/criteria/days_till_recognition_for_delete
Configuration.Description: The number of days after which an artifact is recognised for deletion. Default: "14"

Configuration.Name: compact_blobstore_task/enabled
Configuration.Description: Switch to control whether the policy should be switched on or off. Default: "true"

Configuration.Name: compact_blobstore_task/blobstore
Configuration.Description: The specific blobstore instance to that the task should be applied. This configuration should only be used if the task type is 'blobstore.compact' (or other tasks that need to choose a blobstore instance). Default: "default"

Configuration.Name: compact_blobstore_task/cron
Configuration.Description: Cron string (in Quartz syntax) that sets the task's schedule. The default "0 0 3 * * ?" value will run the task daily at 3:00 AM.

Configuration.Name: carp-limiter/token-rate
Configuration.Description: The token-rate of the carp-limiter in which tokens are added to the bucket in tokens/second. Default is 50

Configuration.Name: carp-limiter/burst-size
Configuration.Description: The size of the bucket for the carp-limiter. It sets the amount of tokens the bucket can hold. Defaults to 150

Configuration.Name: carp-limiter/clean-interval
Configuration.Description: The clean interval in seconds for the carp-limiter, in which old limits from the limiter are cleaned. Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes)

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's memory usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/memory_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal memory requirement. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/swap_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's swap memory usage. Use zero or a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte). 0 will disable swapping.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's CPU core usage. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/cpu_core_request
Configuration.Description: Requests the container's minimal CPU core requirement. Use a positive floating value describing a fraction of 1 CPU core. When you define a value of '0.5', you are requesting half as much CPU time compared to if you asked for '1.0' CPU.

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_limit
Configuration.Description: Limits the container's ephemeral storage usage. Use a positive integer value followed by one of these units [b,k,m,g] (byte, kibibyte, mebibyte, gibibyte).

Configuration.Name: container_config/storage_request
